A tutorial is one method of transferring knowledge and may be used as a part of learning. More interactive and specific than a book or a lecture; a tutorial seeks to teach by example and supply the information to complete a certain task.

item.title: [PI] adding your own stalls
item.dc:creator: @hontiris1 hontiris1
item.description:
@hontiris1 wrote:

Purpose: to make your own stalls
Difficulty: 1/10
Assumed Knowledge: a brain.
Classes Modified: showed on thread.
Tested On(if it applies): PI

comment if you are going to use, or i remove

find this on ActionHandler.java

public void secondClickObject(int objectType, int obX, int obY) {

add this under the other stalls or replace them;

case 2561: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1897, 10, 1); break; case 2560: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(950, 30, 25); break; case 2564: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1635, 60, 50); break; case 2565: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(7650, 100, 75); break; case 2562: c.getThieving().stealFromStall(1613, 170, 90); break;

find this on PlayerAssistant.java

public void removeObjects() {

and add this under the remove objects;

objectToRemove(3183, 3484); objectToRemove(3184, 3484); objectToRemove(3185, 3484); objectToRemove(3220, 3425); objectToRemove(3221, 3436); objectToRemove(3217, 3436); objectToRemove(3219, 3436); objectToRemove(3219, 3436); objectToRemove(3220, 3431);

find this on ObjectManagar.java:

public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {

now add this:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2561, 3220, 3424, -1, 10); c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2560, 3221, 3431, 2, 10); c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2564, 3220, 3436, 2, 10); c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2565, 3218, 3436, 2, 10); c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn(2562, 3210, 3436, 2, 10);

if you want to make other stalls from this thread once’s that you like change the following id’s:

2561
2560
2564
2565
2562

change it from all the codes like:

break; case [COLOR="Red"]2560[/COLOR]:

the red ID change it to the id to the stall ID you want. same with others from;

public void secondClickObject(int objectType, int obX, int obY) {

and change the from here to:

c.getPA().checkObjectSpawn([COLOR="red"]2560[/COLOR], 3221, 3431, 2, 10);

the red ID to the one you want from your stall.

same with other’s from;

public void loadCustomSpawns(Client c) {

there you have added the stalls to varrock you can move them around if you don’t like it.

Read full topic
